txt.en: 'Almost liked the forest! Hm, that is good.'
'Indeed, how uncommonly kind of you.'
Merry
'I almost feel that I do not like you, but let us not be hasty.'
Pippin
'Hrum, Hoom! Very odd, indeed. If I had seen you before I heard your voices...'
'I wonder what we will be able to see from the top of this great hill!'
'...I should have trodden on you, mistaking you for little Orcs!'
'I don't know... but I can taste the fresh air already!'
'But I am glad I didn't, for I liked your voices.'
'It just so happens that the hobbits you seek came not long ago to this very hill.'
'Nice little voices! They call to mind something I cannot remember.'
'Ahh. That's better!'
'Do you feel the wind changing? It is cooler up here.'
'The sunlight will melt back into the clouds soon....'
'What a pity! I almost liked this place with the sun shining upon it.'
'Very odd you are....'
'If you please, who... rather, what are you?'
'But here, the Ents still mostly sleep, speaking only in passing memories.'
'Hrum, now....'
'This is where you come in. Talk to them, my friend!'
'I am an Ent!'
'Help their eyes see beyond the span of their roots.'
'Fangorn is my name, or Treebeard in some tongues. You may call me Treebeard.'
'I am needed elsewhere, but I believe your influence here will be great.'
'The Ents are old -- older than me, even. They grow tired, tree-ish, sleepy.'
'They care little for the troubles of the world, but war and doom threaten them, as it threatens us all.'
'They know Elf, Man, Dwarf, Ent, and Beast from their old songs.'
'But a creature of the Shire is new, and stirs something in their memory.'
'The hobbits will have a great influence on Treebeard, and he on them.'
